events.name: Repaid April 2025 and June 2025 maturities
events.evidence: Following repayments of April 2025 and June 2025 maturities

events.name: Began a share repurchase program in 2022
events.evidence: The company began a share repurchase program in 2022

events.name: Did not repurchase shares in 2024 or 1Q25
events.evidence: the company did not repurchase shares in 2024 or 1Q25

factors.name: CP usage expected to support seasonal working capital swings
factors.evidence: Fitch expects CP usage to primarily support seasonal working capital swings.

factors.name: Fitch expects company to refinance maturities as they come due
factors.evidence: Fitch expects the company to refinance these maturities as they come due.

factors.name: Unsecured debt balance could increase to support growth initiatives
factors.evidence: Amazon's unsecured debt balance could increase over time to support growth initiatives

factors.name: Company could use FCF to reduce debt as done previously
factors.evidence: it could use FCF to reduce debt as it has sometimes done previously.

factors.name: Company could issue debt to execute M&A activities
factors.evidence: The company could also issue debt to execute M&A activities

factors.name: Fitch assumes about $5 billion of buybacks annually
factors.evidence: Fitch assumes there will be about $5 billion of buybacks annually.

factors.name: Company has not indicated plans to resume share repurchases
factors.evidence: has not indicated plans to resume share repurchases.

variables.name: cash and cash equivalents
variables.evidence: Amazon's liquidity as of March 31, 2025, included $66.2 billion in cash and cash equivalents.

variables.name: CP program
variables.evidence: The company has a $30 billion CP program, undrawn as of March 31, 2025

variables.name: unsecured RCF
variables.evidence: its $15 billion unsecured RCF due November 2028

variables.name: 364-day unsecured revolver
variables.evidence: its 364-day, $5 billion unsecured revolver due October 2025

variables.name: unsecured notes
variables.evidence: Amazon's debt includes about $55 billion of unsecured notes
